common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems with account linking, specifically linking multiple accounts like Google and GitHub simultaneously.  Additionally, users experience difficulties connecting to cloud services and utilizing local LLMs due to potential firewall restrictions, network configuration issues, or hardware limitations. Solutions involved improved account linking flows, log analysis, and exploring alternative local LLMs.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Account Linking Problem

**Key Points:**

* User @johnkennyuk was experiencing issues linking their personal domain account (associated with their Google account) to their Pieces account.
* The existing account linking flow was identified as outdated and complex.
* Pieces support offered several solutions, including merging accounts and a new linking flow set to be released in February.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow was not user-friendly.
* The user's Google and Github accounts were registered with different capitalization in the first character of the email address, causing linking issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Merging the accounts into one main account (Google).
* Implementing a new account linking flow scheduled for release in March.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The merging solution was attempted, but the capitalization issue persisted.
* The user is waiting for the new account linking system to be released in March.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new system will be able to handle email address capitalization differences.
* The user's account will be reset before attempting the new linking process.

Shareable link is not generating . 
## Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* They resolved the issue themselves.

**Problems:**

## Additional Notes

* Response timeframe of 24 hours was established.
* Resources provided for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Cloud and Local LLM Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with both cloud and local LLM services.
* Problems included errors with cloud service requests and local model functionality.
* Initial troubleshooting involved log analysis and scheduling a call for further investigation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests to PiecesOS.
* Hardware constraints affecting local LLM functionality.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing logs to identify potential issues.
* Scheduling a call for deeper investigation and root cause analysis.
* Removing the personal OpenApi key for cloud LLM access.
* Utilizing a smaller local LLM to address hardware limitations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.
* Cloud LLM issue was due to the use of a personal OpenApi key.
* Local LLM issue was likely caused by hardware constraints.

**Additional Notes:**

* The call between Rohanrathi99 and Mark-at-Pieces took place on February 25th, 2025.
* The issue was closed after the successful resolution of both problems.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts with Pieces OS' built-in Ollama instance and externally installed ones, leading to CUDA errors and installation failures. Solutions include ensuring proper installation order, clean uninstalls and reinstalls, and verifying network connectivity for cloud services. Further investigation may involve log analysis and direct support interaction.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* johnkennyuk experiences issues with Ollama on Pieces OS, specifically Cuda errors.
* The user suspects a corrupt installation or conflict with existing Ollama instance.
* Startup order is suspected to be the issue, as Pieces OS starts before Ollama.

**Problems identified:**

* Multiple installations of Ollama exist, causing conflicts.
* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama doesn't fully resolve the issue.
* Pieces OS attempts to start its own Ollama instance even when an external one exists.
* Startup order leads to Ollama server not being detected by Pieces OS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Clean uninstallation of both Ollama and Pieces OS.
* Reinstallation of Ollama using the official installer.
* Restarting Pieces OS after running the Ollama app.
* Manual cleanup of PATH environment variables.
* Pieces OS update to 11.1.2 for potential race condition fix.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue temporarily resolved itself after uninstalls and cleanup.
* It resurfaced after updates, indicating persistence.
* The user will update and report back.

**Additional notes:**

* The user prefers using Winget for installations and updates.
* The cause of the conflict might be related to startup order and detection of existing Ollama instance.
* Further investigation and possibly a video call are needed for a definitive solution.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** User @waseem852 is experiencing issues with Ollama integration in Pieces. They have tried various installation methods, including through Pieces and winget, but the issue persists.

**Key Points:**

* Ollama installation fails regardless of method used.
* User has tried restarting Pieces OS and Desktop.
* User has uninstalled and reinstalled Ollama multiple times.
* User has ensured both Pieces apps are shut down after uninstall.
* User has even killed both apps through Task Manager.

**Solutions Proposed:**

* Restarting Pieces OS and Desktop.
* Checking related issues on GitHub.
* Consulting Pieces documentation and YouTube channel.
* Scheduling a call with @brian-at-pieces for further debugging.

**Solutions Implemented:**

* User confirmed trying restarting Pieces OS and Desktop.
* User confirmed checking related issues.
* User confirmed consulting documentation and YouTube channel.
* User scheduled a call with @brian-at-pieces for further debugging.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A call has been scheduled between the user and @brian-at-pieces for further troubleshooting. The exact solution and outcome are pending this call.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Cloud and Local LLM Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with both cloud and local LLM services.
* Problems included errors with cloud service requests and local model functionality.
* Initial troubleshooting involved log analysis and scheduling a call for further investigation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests to PiecesOS.
* Hardware constraints affecting local LLM functionality.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing logs to identify potential issues.
* Scheduling a call for deeper investigation and root cause analysis.
* Removing the personal OpenApi key for cloud LLM access.
* Utilizing a smaller local LLM to address hardware limitations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.
* Cloud LLM issue was due to the use of a personal OpenApi key.
* Local LLM issue was likely caused by hardware constraints.

**Additional Notes:**

* The call between Rohanrathi99 and Mark-at-Pieces took place on February 25th, 2025.
* The issue was closed after the successful resolution of both problems.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and Desktop app launching properly. Problems include conflicts between installations, OneDrive file access issues, and non-dismissable overlay messages. Solutions involve deleting conflicting files, checking startup configurations, and analyzing logs for network or hardware constraints.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User, MR-AAYU, is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces for Developers application.
* User provided log files which indicate two installations of Pieces for Developers.
* User is also unable to launch Pieces OS.

**Problems identified:**

* Two installations of Pieces for Developers causing conflicts.
* Pieces OS trying to access files in OneDrive location, preventing launch.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User should delete the OneDrive directory named "come.pieces.os".
* User should provide information about their machine for further troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User needs to delete the OneDrive directory and try launching Pieces OS again.
* Further troubleshooting to be done via a scheduled call, if necessary.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

- User ThemePark is unable to launch the Pieces Desktop app.
- The app crashes with an error message stating "Pieces OS is not running."
- The user is using Windows 10 and has PiecesOS, Desktop and VS Code installed.

**Problems identified:**

- There might be a conflict between PiecesOS and the Desktop app when both are launched on Startup.
- The crash with the non-dismissable overlay message occurs consistently.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- Mack, the Pieces support representative, suggested that the user check if either PiecesOS or Desktop is configured to launch on Startup.
- ThemePark confirmed that only PiecesOS was in the Startup Apps.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The user continues to experience crashes and the non-dismissable overlay message is impacting their daily work.
- ThemePark is investigating further to identify reproducible circumstances and will update the issue with any new information.

**Additional details:**

- The issue seems to be specific to using Pieces for VS Code.
- Restarting the computer remains the only way to remove the non-dismissable overlay message.

**Next steps:**

- The user will continue to investigate and provide updates.
- The Pieces support team is available to assist further if needed.

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces for Developers failing to connect to cloud services or local LLMs, often due to network configuration or hardware constraints.  Solutions include verifying network settings, adjusting firewall rules, using smaller LLMs, and analyzing logs.  Additionally, a non-dismissable overlay message appears on startup for some Windows users, requiring a system restart.  This issue is under investigation.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* mariusz-kowalski reported an issue they were facing.
* pieces-support-bot thanked them and provided some resources.
* mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and mentioned a potential similar case.
* mack-at-pieces confirmed previous occurrences and requested a log file for further investigation.
* mariusz-kowalski provided the requested log file and expressed their inability to join a live session.

**Problems Identified:**

* mariusz-kowalski encountered an issue they were unable to resolve.
* The specific cause of the issue was unclear.
* The issue seemed to be related to specific Linux machines.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* mack-at-pieces requested a log file for analysis.
* A live troubleshooting session was offered but declined.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* The investigation will be based on the provided log file.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation was polite and collaborative.
* Both pieces-support-bot and mack-at-pieces were responsive and helpful.

### Software

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

- User ThemePark is unable to launch the Pieces Desktop app.
- The app crashes with an error message stating "Pieces OS is not running."
- The user is using Windows 10 and has PiecesOS, Desktop and VS Code installed.

**Problems identified:**

- There might be a conflict between PiecesOS and the Desktop app when both are launched on Startup.
- The crash with the non-dismissable overlay message occurs consistently.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- Mack, the Pieces support representative, suggested that the user check if either PiecesOS or Desktop is configured to launch on Startup.
- ThemePark confirmed that only PiecesOS was in the Startup Apps.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The user continues to experience crashes and the non-dismissable overlay message is impacting their daily work.
- ThemePark is investigating further to identify reproducible circumstances and will update the issue with any new information.

**Additional details:**

- The issue seems to be specific to using Pieces for VS Code.
- Restarting the computer remains the only way to remove the non-dismissable overlay message.

**Next steps:**

- The user will continue to investigate and provide updates.
- The Pieces support team is available to assist further if needed.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crashes and Errors
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashing or encountering errors, particularly with the Long Term Memory engine and cloud services. This often manifests as the app crashing on startup, displaying a non-dismissable overlay message, or failing to connect to cloud/local LLMs. Proposed solutions include checking internet connection, disabling conflicting startup apps, and ensuring sufficient system resources for local LLMs.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I enable Long term memory engine on and use it on pieces for dev or vscode when I try to prompt anything, piecesOS shit's off and starts looping on restart until I manage in the seconds it stays on to disable the LTM engine.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage on Linux Mint 22.1.
* Pieces OS cannot see code inside a sandbox in the browser.
* Non-dismissable overlay message.

**Problems identified:**

* Inefficient resource utilization.
* Limited code visibility in sandboxed environment.
* Annoying and persistent overlay message.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* No specific solutions proposed or implemented within the provided conversation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue acknowledged and routed to the appropriate team member for investigation and resolution.
* User directed to helpful resources and related issues.

**Note:** This summary is based on the provided conversation excerpt. Additional details might be available in the full conversation thread.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Cloud and Local LLM Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues with both cloud and local LLM services.
* Problems included errors with cloud service requests and local model functionality.
* Initial troubleshooting involved log analysis and scheduling a call for further investigation.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firewall or network configuration blocking outgoing requests to PiecesOS.
* Hardware constraints affecting local LLM functionality.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Analyzing logs to identify potential issues.
* Scheduling a call for deeper investigation and root cause analysis.
* Removing the personal OpenApi key for cloud LLM access.
* Utilizing a smaller local LLM to address hardware limitations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Both cloud and local LLM issues have been resolved.
* Cloud LLM issue was due to the use of a personal OpenApi key.
* Local LLM issue was likely caused by hardware constraints.

**Additional Notes:**

* The call between Rohanrathi99 and Mark-at-Pieces took place on February 25th, 2025.
* The issue was closed after the successful resolution of both problems.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of account linking issues:** The most active ticket (610) highlights persistent problems with account linking, impacting user experience for years.  Address this urgently to improve user satisfaction.

**Investigate and resolve Ollama integration conflicts:** Multiple tickets report conflicts with Pieces OS' built-in Ollama and externally installed versions.  Provide clear guidance on installation order, compatibility, and troubleshooting steps.

**Address Pieces OS and Desktop app launch issues:** Several tickets report problems with app launches, including conflicts, OneDrive access errors, and non-dismissable overlays.  Thoroughly test and address these issues to ensure a smooth user experience.

**Improve error messaging and logging:** Vague error messages like "trouble reaching our cloud services" make it difficult for users to troubleshoot.  Provide more specific error messages and detailed logs to aid in diagnosis.

**Consider hardware constraints for local LLM usage:** Issues with local LLM functionality point to potential hardware limitations.  Provide clear system requirements and guidance on choosing appropriate LLMs based on available resources.

**Proactively monitor for and address the non-dismissable overlay issue:** This recurring issue forces users to restart their systems.  Investigate its root cause and implement a fix to prevent further disruption.
**Review and update documentation:** Ensure all documentation, including installation guides, troubleshooting steps, and FAQs, is up-to-date and addresses the reported issues.
**Gather user feedback on LTM engine:** The LTM engine causing crashes requires further investigation.  Gather user feedback and logs to identify specific scenarios triggering the issue.
